text:
Has anyone encountered a bug in FOP version 0.17.0 which involves a BASIC-LINK
not moving with it content?  I have a table which contains table cells that
contain basic links.  My table is placed on the page about 4 inches from the
left side of the page.  However, the link does not move with the table even
though the data content of the link does.  Let me know if you need a better
description of this bug.

Thanks,
Rob Breidecker
creator: robert.a.breidecker@firstar.com

text:
Seems to have been fixed already (for 0.18.1)
My justification fix for bug 953 shouldn't have affected this.
Test case is in newlinktest.fo
creator: camk@channelpoint.com
honkkis@tml.hut.fi
text:
Created attachment 73
the link error happens with this document

There is still a bug in FOP 18.0.1-dev: When using the following (see 
attachment for full .fo file):

<fo:flow flow-name="xsl-region-body">
<fo:block-container height="4cm" width="12cm" top="0cm" left="4cm" 
position="absolute">
 <fo:block text-align="start" line-height="18pt" font-family="sans-serif" font-
weight="bold" font-size="14pt">
 <fo:basic-link external-destination="ma.xml">
 Newburyport, MA 01950
 </fo:basic-link>
 </fo:block>
</fo:block-container>
</fo:flow>

- Mikko Honkala, honkkis@tml.hut.fi - http://www.x-smiles.org
creator: honkkis@tml.hut.fi

text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
